snippet: Drugs called checkpoint inhibitors that harness the immune system to fight cancer can, in rare cases, cause heart damage. Patients may need extra heart tests during treatment....
abstract: Study published in The New England Journal of Medicine warns cancer medications known as checkpoint inhibitors, which harness immune system to fight disease, has in rare cases caused heart damage and even death; doctors hope risk will not deter patients from what is considered highly promising treatment.
lead_paragraph: Drugs called checkpoint inhibitors that harness the immune system to fight cancer can, in rare cases, cause heart damage. Patients may need extra heart tests during treatment.

headline.main: Lifesaving Cancer Drugs May in Rare Cases Threaten the Heart
headline.print_headline: Lifesaving Cancer Drugs May in Rare Cases Cause Heart Damage, Doctors Report
